DOC.brief_summary: This randomize , open-label , crossover study evaluate relative bioavailability ritonavir-boosted danoprevir fix dose combination tablet ( FDC ) compare ad hoc combination reference tablet danoprevir ritonavir healthy volunteer . Subjects randomize 1 6 treatment sequence receive single oral dos either FDC danoprevir ritonavir danoprevir ritonavir separate tablet . In crossover design , subject participate 3 study period least 7-day washout period . In Part 2 , single dose administration film-coated FDCs compare reference tablet .
DOC.brief_title: A Study The Relative Bioavailability Ritonavir-Boosted Danoprevir Fixed Dose Combination Tablets Healthy Volunteers
DOC.criteria: Male female volunteer , 18 55 year age Body weight > /= 50.0 kg Body mass index ( BMI ) 18.0 32.0 kg/m2 Healthy nonsmoking subject . Healthy status define absence evidence active chronic disease follow detailed medical surgical history complete physical examination Medical history without major , recent , ongoing pathology Females childbearing potential male female partner childbearing potential must agree use 2 form contraception , 1 must barrier method , study 90 day last drug administration Pregnant lactate woman male female partner pregnant lactate Any history clinically significant cardiovascular cerebrovascular disease , hypertension , and/or infection Positive result drug abuse screen prior admission clinical site study period Positive hepatitis B , hepatitis C HIV infection Current smoker subject discontinue smoke less 6 month prior first dose study medication Use hormonal contraceptive ( e.g . birth control pill , patch , injectable , implantable device ) within 30 day first dose study medication Use investigational drug device within 30 day first dose study medication ( 6 month biologic therapy ) 5 halflives investigational drug , whichever long History drugrelated allergic reaction hepatotoxicity History ( within 3 month screen ) alcohol consumption exceed 2 standard drink per day average
